messages.content:
You‚Äôre working with three Unity projects that share an ECS library:

Godgame

Root:
C:\Users\Moni\Documents\claudeprojects\unity\Godgame

Scripts:
Assets/Scripts/Godgame/**

Key files:

Assets/Scripts/Godgame/Camera/GodgameCameraController.cs

Assets/Scripts/Godgame/Demo/DebugEntitySystem.cs

Assets/Scripts/Godgame/Villages/VillageDebugSystem.cs

Assets/Scripts/Godgame/Demo/VillagerDebugHUD.cs

Assets/Shared/Demo/EnsureSrpEarly.cs

Assets/Shared/Demo/RenderDiagEarly.cs

Scene of interest:
Assets/Scenes/Godgame_VillagerDemo.unity

Space4x

Root:
C:\Users\Moni\Documents\claudeprojects\unity\Space4x

Scripts:
Assets/Scripts/Space4x/**

There is (or was) a test scene used to visualize PureDOTS orbiting cubes.

PureDOTS ECS shared library

Root:
C:\Users\Moni\Documents\claudeprojects\unity\PureDOTS

This is a shared package-only project, not a game.

Package root (from the games‚Äô perspective):
Packages/com.moni.puredots ‚Üí mapped to the PureDOTS project folder.

Important runtime/demo files (inside the package):

Packages/com.moni.puredots/Runtime/Demo/Rendering/SharedRenderBootstrap.cs

Packages/com.moni.puredots/Runtime/Demo/Village/VillageBehaviorComponents.cs

Packages/com.moni.puredots/Runtime/Demo/Village/VillageDemoBootstrapSystem.cs

Packages/com.moni.puredots/Runtime/Demo/Village/VillageVisualSetupSystem.cs

Packages/com.moni.puredots/Runtime/Demo/Village/VillagerWalkLoopSystem.cs

Packages/com.moni.puredots/Runtime/Demo/Village/OrbitCubeSystem.cs

Architectural intent:

PureDOTS = shared ECS foundations + small engine-agnostic demos.

No game-specific code (Godgame / Space4x gameplay) should live in PureDOTS.

Game logic and scenes must live in Godgame and Space4x projects.

Right now some demo systems (village + orbit cubes) live under PureDOTS/Runtime/Demo/‚Ä¶, and we‚Äôre using them from the game projects for debugging.

Symptoms
In Godgame (Godgame_VillagerDemo scene)

What we see:

Cyan sanity cube at (0,1,0)

Big ground plane and several rows of cubes at positions like:

(-8,0,0) ‚Ä¶ (8,0,0) (scale 3)

(-8,0.86,1.6) ‚Ä¶ (8,0.86,1.6) (scale 2)

Some at x=-6..+1.5, z=2 (scale 1)

So ECS is running and Entities Graphics is rendering something.

What we don‚Äôt see:

No huge magenta debug cube from OrbitCubeSystem at (0,1,0) with scale 10.

No 4 colored orbiting cubes around the origin.

No visible village row-of-homes / row-of-work / villagers in between.

Logs we see:

[EnsureSrpEarly] SRP set to UniversalRenderPipelineAsset before world bootstrap.

[RenderDiagEarly] SRP:UniversalRenderPipelineAsset API:Direct3D11 Compute:True

[SharedRenderBootstrap] RenderMeshArray ready. Shader: Universal Render Pipeline/Simple Lit

[VillageVisualSetupSystem] Render components added for village entities.

[DebugEntitySystem] Total Entities with LocalTransform: 41 plus the positions above.

[VillageDebugSystem] Villages: 0, Villagers: 0

Crucially:
üëâ No logs from OrbitCubeSystem in Godgame at all.
üëâ Changes made in the PureDOTS repo often do not trigger a recompile in the Godgame project, while they do for Space4x.

In Space4x

When testing earlier, PureDOTS changes did trigger recompile, and we saw logs like:

[OrbitCubeSystem] Spawned 5 orbit cubes (including big debug cube).

But even there, we did not see the orbiting cubes in the view, only the sanity cube. That suggests that:

Systems run, but

Either rendering setup or camera/frustum/clipping is wrong.

What I want you to do

Please diagnose and fix the ECS wiring and rendering visibility issues, taking into account that:

Godgame and Space4x are separate Unity projects.

PureDOTS is a shared library project used as a local package by both.

Work directly on these projects and make code / asmdef / manifest changes as needed.

1. Verify PureDOTS is correctly referenced from both games

For each game project:

Open

C:\Users\Moni\Documents\claudeprojects\unity\Godgame\Packages\manifest.json

C:\Users\Moni\Documents\claudeprojects\unity\Space4x\Packages\manifest.json

Confirm com.moni.puredots is included as a local package pointing to the PureDOTS root, e.g. via "file:" or "local" reference.

Make sure the path and version are correct and consistent between Godgame and Space4x.

If Godgame is still pointing to an old copy or not referencing it at all, fix that so changes in C:\‚Ä¶\PureDOTS cause a recompile in Godgame.

2. Check asmdef references between PureDOTS and the games

In PureDOTS:

Find the assembly definition(s) that contain:

OrbitCubeSystem

The Village* systems (VillageDemoBootstrapSystem, VillageVisualSetupSystem, VillagerWalkLoopSystem, etc.).

This is likely something under Packages/com.moni.puredots/Runtime/**.asmdef.

In Godgame and Space4x:

Locate the asmdefs for:

Assets/Scripts/Godgame/**

Assets/Scripts/Space4x/**

Ensure:

The Godgame asmdef(s) reference the relevant PureDOTS runtime asmdef(s) so ECS systems and components are visible in Godgame‚Äôs world.

The Space4x asmdef(s) do the same.

After fixing references, confirm that:

Godgame‚Äôs console shows logs from OrbitCubeSystem (add Debug.Log in its OnCreate and first OnUpdate if needed).

The game re-compiles when modifying source in the PureDOTS repo.

3. Verify world / system registration & filters

In PureDOTS:

Inspect bootstrap/world configuration code inside the package that:

Creates the Entities world

Registers systems like:

OrbitCubeSystem

Village demo systems

Also inspect any system filters:

UpdateInGroup

WorldSystemFilter attributes

Custom bootstrap that chooses which systems to include

In Godgame & Space4x:

Examine GodgameSampleRegistryAuthoring and any other registry or config components under:

Assets/Scripts/Godgame/**

Assets/Scripts/Space4x/**

Confirm that:

The world that runs in Godgame_VillagerDemo actually includes OrbitCubeSystem and the village demo systems.

Systems aren‚Äôt unintentionally filtered out by a custom registry or world-filter logic.

Add temporary logging in these systems:

UnityEngine.Debug.Log("[OrbitCubeSystem] OnCreate in world: " + state.WorldUnmanaged.Name);


for each relevant system, so we can see which world they run in, and whether they run at all in Godgame vs Space4x.

4. Confirm that village entities are actually spawned in Godgame‚Äôs world

In VillageDemoBootstrapSystem.cs (in PureDOTS):

Make sure it runs in the same world as Godgame‚Äôs debug systems.

Check that it creates:

At least one entity with VillageTag

Villagers with VillagerTag

Home/work lots

In Assets/Scripts/Godgame/Villages/VillageDebugSystem.cs:

Ensure the queries for VillageTag and VillagerTag are correct and using EntityQuery on the same world as the bootstrap system.

Right now it logs Villages: 0, Villagers: 0; after fixes we want non-zero there.

5. Rendering / visibility issues (Space4x & Godgame)

Once systems are actually running in both projects:

Confirm that for every visual ECS entity (village pieces, orbit cubes), entities have:

LocalTransform

MaterialMeshInfo with the correct index

A shared RenderMeshArray (or the equivalent pattern used by SharedRenderBootstrap).

Verify that:

The indices used by OrbitCubeSystem match those populated in SharedRenderBootstrap.

The assigned meshes/materials are visible under URP.

Check each game‚Äôs main camera:

Looks at/near (0,0,0).

Has far/near planes and position that would actually see the large debug cube (scale 10 at (0,1,0)) and the orbiters (scale 3 at radius ~6).

If necessary, temporarily spawn an enormous bright debug cube (e.g. scale 20) at (0,1,0) from a system you can prove is running, to verify rendering.

6. Respect the ‚Äúno game logic in PureDOTS‚Äù rule

While diagnosing, please also:

Keep PureDOTS strictly as a shared ECS foundation + generic debug/demo.

Make sure:

No Godgame-specific or Space4x-specific code creeps into PureDOTS.

If you need game-specific behaviors, add thin wrappers/systems inside each game project, possibly driving engine-agnostic components defined in PureDOTS.

If you find that something currently in PureDOTS is clearly game-specific, call it out and suggest a clean relocation into Godgame or Space4x.

Final deliverables

Fixes so that:

In Godgame_VillagerDemo:

OrbitCubeSystem and village systems run in the Godgame world.

We see logs from OrbitCubeSystem.

VillageDebugSystem reports non-zero villages/villagers.

Orbiting debug cubes and/or village cubes are actually visible from the Godgame camera.

In Space4x:

We both see the orbit system logs and the visual cubes in the relevant scene.

A short summary of:

Which manifests/asmdefs you changed and why.

How the worlds and systems are now registered for each project.

Any structural recommendations you made to keep PureDOTS ‚Äúfoundation-only‚Äù and games decoupled.

arguments.task_progress:
- [ ] Verify PureDOTS reference in Godgame manifest
- [ ] Verify PureDOTS reference in Space4x manifest
- [ ] Check and fix asmdef references in PureDOTS
- [ ] Check and fix asmdef references in Godgame
- [ ] Check and fix asmdef references in Space4x
- [ ] Add logging to OrbitCubeSystem and Village systems in PureDOTS
- [ ] Verify system registration and world filtering in Godgame
- [ ] Verify system registration and world filtering in Space4x
- [ ] Confirm village entities spawning in Godgame
- [ ] Diagnose and fix rendering/visibility issues (Camera, RenderMeshArray)
- [ ] Verify fixes in Godgame (Logs + Visuals)
- [ ] Verify fixes in Space4x (Logs + Visuals)
- [ ] Ensure architectural separation (No game logic in PureDOTS)
